website_summaries.verdict: If you need a replacement mouse and keyboard, and you plan on sitting relatively close to your PC, smart TV, or other touchpad-compatible tech, this inexpensive solution may be right for you.
pros: Touchpad is as simple to use as a traditional mouse
cons: While the intuitive touchpad is great, its fairly short 10-meter wireless range could be better

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this product unless your keyboard will sit within 3 feet of the USB dongle and have a completely unobstructed line of sight. And I mean COMPLETELY unobstructured. It will barely work if you are farther than that, or if there is even a small object in the way. There’s a reason this keyboard is cheaper than the other comparable alternatives - do yourself a favor, spend a little bit more money, and get a keyboard that actually has a strong and dependable connection.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: It works as described, can be better.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Works as described - Reasonably priced - fair amount of info available here - small size - touchpad can be turned off if required. - physical mouse buttons - Win and Context-menu keys! Cons - - No info on how to completely disable tap-to-click that I have been able to find. Granted, I haven't looked very hard due to lack of time. - Got a used unit, as there were marks on the unit. Because I am on a deadline, didn't want to go through the hassle of returning it. Bad, Mr. seller! Suggestions for future products: - A documented way to disable tap-to-click! - Full-size shift keys on both the sides of the keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: bad design, loss of keypad functionality when in use
customer_reviews.text: been using this keyboard for couple of weeks.. and i have to say - it's oddly designed. from an ergonomic standpoint. excessive use gives me a cramp, on this mini keyboard (i have others, that dont give me same issues) AND the most annoying bit is the mousepad going to sleep or something while actively in use. it's like it's on a timer even when im am actively scrolling/reading. pointless.. been using my wireless mouse.. looking for another keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: shashank

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy returning things.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time. Touch pad worked fine, but none of the keys would work. If you enjoy returning things to Amazon buy this item. Otherwise don’t. Spend a few more bucks and get something different. Spend a few more bucks and buy a different brand. I know a lot of the reviews say the customer service is great, but something like this should work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Man

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst keyboard ive ever owned. Goes through batteries like crazy. Maybe i got a lemon? Seems like once a month im replacing them (my logitech keyboard of similar size only needs the batteries replaced once or twice a year) this has terrible range, the touch pad has awful tracking which makes it very difficult to do anything precise with the mouse, and is often times unresponsive and requires switching the keyboard off and back on before it will work. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FTW

customer_reviews.title: All good,touch pad is kinda annoying though
customer_reviews.text: I generally like this product it takes a little while to adjust too but I'd ultimately say it's worth the money. The reason I give it 4 stars is because of the touch pad I have big meaty claws so sometimes I accidentally double click on the touchpad when I don't want to. The upside of the product is that you can turn the pad off and still use the keyboard but then it's like who wants to use a mouse. Anyway I still reccomend this product
customer_reviews.author: Rex T. Paradox

customer_reviews.title: Freezes, Locks up
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year and find this keyboard really frustrating. It's always had an issue "locking up" or losing it's connection to the PC. I'm using it about 3 feet away from the PC itself. I've had another brand before this one and never had this issue. The only way to unfreeze it is to hit the lock button repeatedly 3 or 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Benton

customer_reviews.title: Works with Raspberry Pi!!
customer_reviews.text: For $20 I think you would be stretched to find something better. Bought for a Raspberry Pi. Works great! uses AAAs (not included) dongle stored in battery compartment. comfortable using sitting on a couch. on/off switch on the bottom. red light flashes once when turned on. connects almost instantly. the Not So Good: feels like a membrane keyboard. a little inconsistent key feel but it works for Kodi, web browsing etc. my @ symbol is " (shift 2) - not sure if theres a software fix for that? board flexes but breaking it would have to be intentional.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Almost Full Size
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality little keyboard. I'm using it to control the software in a photo booth. It works great and the touchpad is very responsive. It's not full size but almost. It's not tiny like some of the keyboards you see for controlling TVs. The little blue tooth plug is in the compartment where the batteries go. You need AAA batteries for this keyboard. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Not too good
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is not that good for a wireless with touchpad. It keeps going to sleep mode while I'm using it. Especially when I'm using the touchpad to scroll through open windows. Don't have the same issues with a wireless Logitech touchpad, which I use on a different computer.
customer_reviews.author: Imperion1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard, with one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and feel of this keyboard. The only thing I didn't like about it was the lack of a left "mouse" button on the left side of the keyboard. I use wireless keyboards all the time with four computers in my home, and my other keyboards all have a button on the top left for the left "mouse" button. It's a matter of retraining myself not to expect that, but it would be great if you could fit such a button in the upper left corner of the keyboard. As things stand now, the absolute best wireless keyboard/touch pads out there are the Logitech K400 series - K400, K400r, K400+.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Really love this keyboard. Not To small or too long. Easy to use. However 2 days after first use,some of the keys were sticking. I had to rip it out so I could keep using the keyboard since its the only one I had. Update 2019 After posting my view about this keyboard not expecting anything really the company I bought it from replaced it with a new one and it works fine. Apparently the first one must have been faulty. So right now I've no issues and it works great. I love this keyboard. Go ahead and get yours.
customer_reviews.author: nigel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good value!
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this to use while in bed so I did not have wires stretched over my girlfriend while she slept. I ended up giving it to my Mother because after we broke up I had no need for it lol. Pros: Works good with smart TVs. Great replacement for laptops with worn out touch pads and keys. Light weight and it seems to hold ok battery life. Cons: Being light weight as it is,it feels fragile and may not be durable. There is no kick stands or rubber grips under the device so it slips and slides around in some scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Mr-Somes

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased two other wireless keyboards (a 1-by-one, and a Logitech K400) both of which caused the display screen of my AWOW Compute-Stick to constantly switch between full-screen and half screen, as well as various other unwanted effects which made my experience miserable. By far the 1-by-one was the worst. Since purchasing the VicTsing Keyboard, I have had absolutely none of the problems the others continually caused, so I have also bought a second VicTsing for my sister.....This is an excellent product! As an update: This VicTsing Mini Wireless Touchpad/Keyboard has continued to function flawlessly....I recommend this product without any reservations whatsoever! And, NO...I do not work for VicTsing, or any parent or subsidiary company.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ruhl Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The form factor is horrible, at least is used for typing. The letter and number section is slightly smaller than a regular keyboard. More importantly, the space between keys is smaller too. Bottom line, you’ll have to relearn your muscle memory for typing. For instance, in two minutes of typing I hit the Cap Lock button instead of the letter A about 6 times. Returning it tomorrow and will look for a full-size wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.author: B. Moore

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is not bad, typing is easy and comfortable depending on what surface you’re using it in. The trackpad is okay at best, but that may be because I’m using it on a Mac and this keyboard is more for Windows. Wish it had little kickstand feet like other keyboards do, that would be better. Also, note to the seller, please don’t send so many emails trying to force a review out of a customer. It’s quite annoying and makes the experience worse in my opinion .
customer_reviews.author: Hipsterblox

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about it. You cant plug it in to charge.(I'm sure the designer knew this designing it who am I kidding people usually know exactly what they're doing but don't get me wrong) The mouse pad is very sensitive maybe it can be adjusted I don't know I don't spend that much Time on the computer.. If it was like 2in bigger it would be radical. Overall it's ok because it's small it does take awhile getting use to .
customer_reviews.author: Known Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent working capabilities
customer_reviews.text: Put batteries in it and it didn't work. Changed the batteries and put it aside to work on something else and came back and the keyboard worked. Went to use it the next day and it didn't work but, it worked the next two days after that before it stopped working again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connection goes out eventually, BUT GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: The company reached out to me and send me a new one free of charge! They even have followed up with me to make sure this one wasn't defective as well. I want to include my previous comment below to show my dissatisfaction that was quickly addressed by their team. I completely recommend this keyboard!! This worked really great for about a month and enabled me to use the trackpad rather than having an extra mouse around. It did how ever start having faulty connection issues and wound up in the trash before long.
customer_reviews.author: MyGuyElectronics

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I needed this keyboard for an HTPC and it was the cheapest I could find as I did not need anything fancy. Fortunately, it works, however, I have to make sure it is within 10 feet or less of the fab or else the ability to use the keyboard spirals downhill quickly. I will still get good use out of it, now knowing its limitations, but buyer beware as the wireless signal distance seems to be sub-par with the item I received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard gets 1 Star because the mousepad works as expected. However, this keyboard is way too small to do any typing with and the shift key doesn’t work. It feels flimsy and cheap. I would not recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: works well so far
customer_reviews.text: I dropped it on the ground right out of the box and still works thank goodness...i turned down the mouse sensitivity and that worked well. We use it for our living room TV from the couch and the PC is inside a cabinet and the 2.4 works fine through the door. it hasent interfered with any other 2.4 source so im pretty happy. Plug and play on Win10 no drivers needed to be downloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Lab

customer_reviews.title: Not workin
customer_reviews.text: Got the product, it looks nice. I put new batteries and tried it. It worked for a minute and touch pad stopped working. No led light indicator. Led indicator flash when you turn the power on. Tried everything but it just does not work. I will be returning mine and get something else. Not a good quality electronics. It is not worth buying for the price. Very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: scvrider

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, not worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Bad product. The first one would not respond no matter what button or what device i plugged it in after about a week. The replacement one skips keys when typing fast. Very bad product
customer_reviews.author: Imteaz

customer_reviews.title: Rightly priced wireless keyboard with MOUSEPAD!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another old similar keyboard, but what I love about this is the mousepad! I only wish that they have the number key pad also. I wouldn't mind if they had extended the keyboard a little more to fit the numeric keypad. Since I use this to type while using the TV as a computer screen, I hate having to enter account numbers from the regular horizontal number key buttons on top of the keyboard.! Otherwise, great price and works well. I recommend this for sure
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: works ok for the price, track pad can be improved but still ok.
customer_reviews.text: Update: (the trak pad stopped working after a few weeks. I am going to return it. )the keyboard works ok size is right keys feel good. The problems are the mouse becomes unresponsive after sitting, some key strokes are missed while typing, the track pad scrolls opposite of a touch screen unlike competitors. touch click will not work some times so I tap the left key. I dont use function keys so i cant comment on their functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Meh, I wanted to like this Keyboard, in all hated it.
customer_reviews.text: This review is based on 2+ months of daily use. Pros: Very Light weight, sleek design. Cons: Durability not good, the keyboard slipped off the coffee table and 4 keys would fall off. Space bar would come loose while using it consistently to type. Usability outside 10ft with direct line to wireless receiver was nearly impossible, would only register half the letters. The mouse pad would not work unless you hit keys on the keyboard first. Almost as if the mouse pad was in sleep mode and had to be woken up.
customer_reviews.author: Daan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Keyboard With Touchpad For A Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I added a Chromebit device to the TV in my home office so I could use it as a big screen PC display and this wireless keyboard was a perfect fit for this setup. It's very easy to use either on my lap or on the desktop and the touchpad is very responsive so I don't miss having a mouse to go with it. I also plan to take this keyboard and the Chromebit device on vacation with me as an alternative to my Chromebook laptop.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, seems to be a great product but is not. I'm only 6 feet away from my PC and the connection between PC and keyboard is unreachable, I end up using a USB cord extension to bring the USB connection closer to the keyboard. It seems to be working better this way. Tha website advertising 10M away from the monitor, 10M is about 30 feet, I was getting no reception in a bit less than 6 feet (about 2 meters)
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great range, long battery life
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tech who travels frequently to diagnose industrial machinery run with Windows computers. This is making my life easier since it lets me get rid of long cables and installs easily into Windows. The touchpad works well and keyboard is fairly rugged .. doesn't seem to have much issue with dirt and oils. Battery life has been good .. still on first set of batteries after 1.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Sheth

customer_reviews.title: Works reliably.
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with just how reliable this wireless keyboard is. I like its small, but not too small, size. Good thing they labeled the touchpad on/off so, if you move your finger around the touchpad -- and if it does not move the mouse pointer -- you can quickly realize that the touchpad on/off button needs a tap.
customer_reviews.author: John Wsol

customer_reviews.title: Nice but is a very small keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I like the keypad feel. The buttons have the right amount of force. However, I did not realize how small it is compared to a normal keypad that I have much difficulty in typing. Especially when I try to tap the space bar with my right thumb I miss and hit the Alt key. Otherwise a good keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mastroberti

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is nice sized.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to add a keyboard to my Amazon FireStick (with an OTG cable and USB hub). It is as described and adds nice functionality to some apps (great for typing in passwords or search terms). It is on the small side which is a benefit and and a drawback. Nice and mobile, but also takes a bit of readjustment if you are used to a full sized keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kickert

customer_reviews.title: Incredible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. Amazing stand-by mode that means I never turn it off even when i shutdown the computer. Lightweight and awesome touchpad. Feels solid when typing and very responsive. The USB insert fits into a space next to the batteries and is brilliantly hidden and safe when travelling. I had a keyboard lose responsiveness and contacted customer service who advised me on fixes and then immediately sent me a new keyboard no questions asked. Honest, kind and fast. I am seriously impressed and my new board looks amazing and never even had to send in the old one. Best customer service experience I have ever have. A+ all around.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Newman

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a secondary Keyboard to my Creative Art & Design workflow. It works well for that purpose and is a reasonable price. For a company, I have never heard of till this product I am relatively hopeful for their future products. Pro: It is affordable and lasts a long time. Finger gestures work, and it is responsive. Cons: Travel of the keys are relatively short. So typing does not feel as satisfying. The space between the keys is very cramped so accidental typos will increase in frequency.
customer_reviews.author: Simbisai Kahari

customer_reviews.title: It responds! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I'm ot sure about gaming, I'm not a gamer. But, I've got 5 different keyboards laying around me, which I need. I tend to get excited over cool stuff. Everyone knows logitech would be the go to...but! This one might change tour mind! The keys are where they should be, and it's response is quick and accurate! I love it! From a 50yr old techy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I have added to my kit in years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Raspberry PI to replace the small handheld Bluetooth keyboard that was a pain to keep working. This was the perfect thing, the wireless does not require any sort of driver, the receiver can be stored securely in the battery compartment. My only complaint is the on-off switch is not in a great location and flops.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Marlowe

customer_reviews.title: Great looks but ....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace another wireless keyboard. The keyboard has nice key layout and decent-sized touchpad. Unfortunately, this is where the good stuff ends. As others have reported, range is very low. I had trouble keeping it functioning from more than 3 feet away. The touchpad periodically stops functioning as well. If you are looking for a good quality and reliable wireless keyboard, it may be wise to consider looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Greg A Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good, not spectacular
customer_reviews.text: It is a cheap product that does what you expect well, but does not feel premium. We use it to plug our laptop to the tv and watch from bed (old tv, not smart) and control the laptop at a distance. It is convenient and works fine, but I would not recommend for gaming or serious typing.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson D Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Odd layout, otherwise fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for controlling the computer attached to my living room TV. The top row of letters are further to the left than on a normal keyboard, and the right shift is small and easy to mix up with the button to disable the touchpad. Other than these small complaints, the battery life and range are excellent. I've only had to replace the batteries once in over a year of use, and it works from anywhere in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Brown

customer_reviews.title: If you want range go with the Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because it was an Amazon Choice product. Range is so so but that is because goes to sleep quickly. Touchpad button doesn't work well so found workaround of turning on CAPS LOCK to wake. I use to control laptop connected to TV. Almost returned but not worth hassle so will use for time being as it was only $20. When I buy the replacement I will go with the Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Bugsy36

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless keyboard for my mini-PC tv & very affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is third wireless keyboard variety I've tried on my home tv_windows mini pc system and it is by FAR the best. My wife likes it too, so it's a certified success! Great price! Works exactly as it should!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Defect
customer_reviews.text: Definitely doesn't work at all for my Samsung TV. Been trying to get it returned so i can get a refund, but with working 7 days a week in a busy beach hotel i never can get time to drop it off at the post office :(
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Range
customer_reviews.text: I tried all in my power to make this work but unfortunately after thinking the range was the problem I put the keyboard literally right next to the reciever, and it still cut in and out of connectivity, I unplugged all the things in my computer that would prioritize the wired connection vs the wireless connection and nothing, currently getting a refund
customer_reviews.author: part901

customer_reviews.title: Wish I didn’t lose the usb receiver :’(
customer_reviews.text: pros: super lightweight, compact, and I was able to use it anywhere in my classroom (true to the radius in the product description), includes responsive touchpad! Cons: very small, tight layout, difficult to type if you have bigger hands
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Works great for media PC
customer_reviews.text: Love the small and light form factor. I wouldn’t try to type a paper with this, as the key layouts makes tough to type fast and accurately. I am using it for PC stick that attaches to the TV. For minimum typing, I think this is a good compromise.
customer_reviews.author: MD NJ

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical because of the reviews but so far its been solid. I didnt have any problems with the track pad either.Can toggle it on or off. In build quality obv. U get what u paid for. But its works well for me with no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: mr.k8ngpin

customer_reviews.title: but it turns out that the size is one of the things I like best about it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when the "S" key broke on my laptop. I was nervous when I saw how small this keyboard was (looks bigger in the photo!), but it turns out that the size is one of the things I like best about it. It fits on my very small desk even with the laptop behind it. I can connect my laptop to my big TV and use my little keyboard from anywhere in the room. I worried about lag, but there's none, and the touchpad works just as well as the one on my laptop. I have only had this for a couple of weeks, but it hasn't needed a battery change yet. Seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer support
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, and the keypad works well. The trackpad likes to freeze up on me while playing games. I lose control for a couple of seconds then it comes back, makes it mostly unusable for any game scenarios. I updated my review to 5 stars. The manufacturer went out of their way to make sure I was satisfied, offering me alternative keyboards. Ultimately I chose one and they provided it free. They did note that the original keyboard was not intended for gaming purposes, I recommend that they state that in the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Coffey

customer_reviews.title: its not great
customer_reviews.text: its ok. its not great. for the most part, it works just as described but my biggest pet peeve is that the trackpad malfunctions CONSTANTLY. so if you dont mind turning the keyboard off and on every couple minutes then go ahead and purchase this semi-reliable contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Carlie

customer_reviews.title: Easy on my wrists
customer_reviews.text: Probably not the best in class but you can't beat the quality for the price. It's small so it's perfect for work so I don't have to move my hands much to reach all the keys. I do miss the numerical key pad but I use my on screen accessible one with the hover option. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDI

customer_reviews.title: Light and durable, very difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is small and light. Easy to operate, when it wants to work. The mousepad is very difficult to use. We have to press very hard and it's next to impossible for our child to operate. It also seems to burn through batteries very fast, even after making sure to turn it off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: bch53007

customer_reviews.title: The Keynote
customer_reviews.text: It worked with my tv immediately after some configuration. Though it took me by surprise, I was expecting flashing lights and a solid confirmation light to let me know it was connected as with most Bluetooth items. Nonetheless, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Cheirs

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: The ability to operate my laptop which I have connected (HDMI) to my 70" flat screen to search videos/movies, and search internet from my couch is excellent. The keys are little light to the touch, so a little added pressure may be necessary. The touch-pad response to the laptop is slightly delayed than a traditional wireless mouse, but I'm content with the performance. The main purpose was to get to a video/movie on-demand I wanted to watch without me having to get up and search in front of my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Martinez

customer_reviews.title: i cant tell if its on or not.. but it works well when it is on
customer_reviews.text: i dont like that the battery switch is underneth. if it was on the side, or on top... it would have been better...(it would have been nice that this is an led indicating that it is on (it seems only light when i switch it on) because the keyboard key for power off, i cant tell if the keyboard is on or off. i velco this keyboard while on the go. other than this... the keyboard works very well!
customer_reviews.author: nyc_buyer of things

customer_reviews.title: not perfect
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, I would say it is adequate. If and when I purchase another wireless keyboard I will definitely look for the ones with the following. First and foremost, back lit keys! Secondly, one that isn't so small your constantly hitting the Y key when you should be typing T. Oh and the track pad is great but its very sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: j2the9thpwr

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard to run the PC i have hooked up to my TV. COnnects instantly, has on-off switch, touch pad works well. I wouldnt use it for gaming but great for surfing the net or basic controls.
customer_reviews.author: Sambed

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this purchase and with vendor's support.
customer_reviews.text: Item received as per offer, on time and well packaged. Installation was extremely easy. As of today performance has been as expected. Vendor gave me great support on a non existent problem.
customer_reviews.author: Wallo

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a lot of gaming but it was a nice keyboard to use with my Raspberry Pi and any other piece of equipment that required a keyboard I tried it with.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: VicTsing Ultra-Slim Mini Wireless Touchpad Keyboard is like Frosted Flakes it's GrrrREAT
customer_reviews.text: I love this little key board. I bought it as a companion to this Z83-F Fanless MINI PC Desktop and they work great together. I'm very pleased at the way they work together.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sebas

customer_reviews.title: Non-standard keyboard layout
customer_reviews.text: I thought the keyboard was a little small, and I wanted it to be small. However, I expected the layout of the keys to be in the same position as a regular keyboard. They are not. It is difficult to type on. Not because of the smaller size but because the spacing of the keys is different from a regular keyboard. In addition the mouse does not work well and often clicks when I'm trying to scroll. Finally the range is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Roelfsema

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this wireless keyboard with touchpad built in so that we could control our computers while not sitting at our desk for various reasons, mostly to flip between shows/videos on the couch. It works wonderfully for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We use it to watch TV via our 'puter. The touch pad and my finger do not always get along. But it is the best for the money. Next time I'll look for a keyboard with a mini-trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Small keyboard that's sit comfortably on the couch. Used for a computer hooked to a TV such as a steam box for gaming or a built media center.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan Wong

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap keyboard, but it does the job for my friends HTPC. Doesn't drop connection, no stutters, missed keys, or anything like that. Time will tell if it's durable, but initial quality seems okay.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C.

customer_reviews.title: An average product
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. The mouse tends to freeze up occasionally. It is smaller than a standard keyboard which takes some getting used to. While this is not a knock on the product itself it's just something to know in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good media keyboard
customer_reviews.text: If it had software that would allow me to customize the gestures (instead of windows 10) it would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: woohair

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's works really well for a media center PC plugged into my living room TV. I don't need a full-sized keyboard and a separate mouse is a pain to track. This is a nice compromise: small enough without being too small.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great combo
customer_reviews.text: Great combo it has made tiring my tv into my computer monitor awesome. The mouse area is very responsive and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: i got this on Mar 4, 2019 and to day 5/5/2019 it dose not work it eat battery like a kid eat candy. not good at all
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Nowland

customer_reviews.title: Much appreciated 😊
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working. Micky immediately followed up and resolved the issue without a doubt. She resent a brand new keyboard. Her customer satisfaction was the key goal to succeed. Many thanks to Micky and the company.
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Use it for control of the PC based security cameras
customer_reviews.text: Works great but distance limited until I plugged in a USB extension cable and elevated USB dongle. Range is 10 times better and totally reliable now.
customer_reviews.author: RobG

customer_reviews.title: It is so small...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is way too small for my fingers and my shoulder structure. If you will use the keyboard to type in a couple of words then it would be fine. But if you plan on using the keyboard for typing longer texts, then it is not very useful. UPDATE: The customer service is very good. they have replaced the keyboard w another one that suits better for me. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Doruk ILGAZ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't function properly.
customer_reviews.text: 8 of the letter keys did not work. 3 different letter keys entered the wrong letter. Not sure if I received a lemon or not but this was not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SCJ

customer_reviews.title: Find a better keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It fell off of my coffee table once and broke. I decided it wasn't even worth it to get another one with the warranty. I may have missed it in the description, but I didn't realize it wasn't a full size keyboard too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W.

customer_reviews.title: Truly Plug-and-play
customer_reviews.text: Does not require any additional drivers or software to function. Used on a Windows 10 machine and a Raspberry Pi 3B+. No issues whatsoever, nice responsive touchpad. Dedicated mute/volume buttons are much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Android boxes
customer_reviews.text: This little keyboard is a great addition to any android box. The functionality and ease is realy simple. Very reliable. I have purchased over 10 of these little keyboards to go with the android boxes I set up. Great buy for the money. I was buying the K400 logitech keyboard, but reliability was always an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Reynold garcia

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or energy.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible keyboard. Constantly looses signal, doesn't register letters half the time or registers multiple of the same letter. Goes through batteries faster than I can buy them. So frustrating. Missed my return date by a week. Was really trying to give it a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: a little smaller then a regular keyboard but now I ...
customer_reviews.text: a little smaller then a regular keyboard but now I can just use this and not have to worry about using a mouse while using my tv as a screen for my computer!.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad keyboard, the touchpad is just ok, It has disconnected a few times, had to turn off and back on.
customer_reviews.author: SAK632

customer_reviews.title: good alternative to other pad wireless keyboards
customer_reviews.text: used on a pc stick plugged in to a tv. well made and works.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Works great, didn’t have to install or do anything extra. We love it. Use it for our desktop connected to our big screen tv for movies and such.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica and Larry

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's a little too small to work well for gaming I'm a programmer it does fine for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Pi
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Rasberry pi arcade build. I only use it when I'm about 2ft away, so I can't speak on the range it can transmit. Totally worth the price for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: @California_Gaming

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality under good design
customer_reviews.text: Space key does not work so return the product. Although it was well designed, the manufacturing and quality need improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Socks

customer_reviews.title: Not worth considering
customer_reviews.text: Failed within the first 90 days of only occasional use
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Bought for wife
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, I never see her anymore. I finally get some peace and quiet thanks to this wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Shoup

customer_reviews.title: Low quality keys, but better than the competition
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is very plastic and cheap feeling. The keys make a loud noise during typing. However, this is better than the Microsoft All In One keyboard and the Logitech k400
customer_reviews.author: Dmh529

customer_reviews.title: Let down
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work well as I thought it would. Wouldn't buy agan
customer_reviews.author: orasbabydoll

customer_reviews.title: Mouse freezes all the time
customer_reviews.text: The mouse and keyboard froze up on me quite often after one month of use. Ended up breaking it
customer_reviews.author: John lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great , easy install
customer_reviews.text: Item did exactly what I had hoped it would , good product , no issues that I can see , very happy
customer_reviews.author: bradoz7

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Don’t care for the usb dongle getting lost constantly but the keyboard did work good. I think I ultimately prefer one with a front trackpad instead too but to each his own.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Watson

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Use it on my Mac air so I can sit on my couch and use my computer on the big screen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it is a good, small wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Would rate it higher, if it weren't for the dumbest design choice I've ever seen on a keyboard. Who puts a track pad on/off switch right next to a half size shift key? Ditch one of the multimedia keys and put it the up there, out of the way so I am not accidentally hitting it all the time. Otherwise it is a good, small wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very bad product. Haven’t had the product long and already it has stopped working. I want my money back
customer_reviews.author: Luke Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Nice appearance but not so functional . . .
customer_reviews.text: The appearance is nice enough but the touchpad and keys do not seem to be in sync. The keyboard needs a warm-up and is not consistent in its operation.
customer_reviews.author: RaMona Washington Keith

customer_reviews.title: It’s an ok product
customer_reviews.text: Love how small it is . The mouse part is always disconnecting it self. Was very hard to use. My son likes it though it’s small so similar to the Mac book he uses in school so I can work on his Typong for school (he’s 9)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Guth

customer_reviews.title: Have AAA batteries on hand
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to interface with my computer while in my virtual reality racing sim. Does exactly what you need it to do. Would have been nice if it came with AAA batteries though since I had to go out and buy some.
customer_reviews.author: Christian M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. It's small, but has all the buttons and at the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and money - don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is terrible. The signal is weak, the battery dies quickly... don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Granado

product_meta.title: VicTsing Wireless Keyboard with Touchpad, 2.4GHz Mini USB Keyboard with Touchpad, Easy Media Control & Built-in Multi-Touch Trackpad for Smart TV HTPC PC Tablet Google Laptop Windows Android, Black
feature_bullets: All-in-one Design-Bid farewell to the mouse. This keyboard comes with a trackpad, which supports effortless multi-touch navigation for easier web browsing. You can sit comfortably on the couch to control your device. But the scrollbar moves horizontally is only available for the software supporting it, such as WEB, Office, etc.

Convenient Multimedia Shortcuts-12 combinations of multimedia shortcuts and 5 media hotkeys provide one-touch access to your content like homepage, data encryption, media player, etc. Make the operation more efficient and reduce the fatigue of frequent operations.

Shortcut Keys for Windows 10-Specifically designed for Windows 10 system, the four keys: F2, F3, F5, F7 with the Fn key can instantly access to application switching, windows setting, operation center and the Share option. It can effectively save your time of operation.

2.4GHz Transmission Technology-Wirelessly connect to your devices with the USB receiver and control your media content from anywhere within a 10-meter range. It allows you to play or work comfortably without being stuck in front of your computer. Plug and play, providing anti-interference stable transmission

Space-saving and Fully Functional-Ultra-thin and lightweight, it’s portable and convenient for you to carry around and use it anywhere. Come with 87 keys and a touchpad, full-featured, compact and space-saving. Designed with frosted keycap and rubber support, which ensures fashion and stability.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars617 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
